intro: Calotis scapigera var. dentata, commonly known as the serrated calotis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and showy, yellow flowers. The leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, giving it its variety name "dentata." It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. This plant is well adapted to arid conditions and is a common sight in native gardens and wild landscapes.
